question: 浸る
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>immersed</kanji>. Things that are immersed are described by verbs like <vocabulary>to be soaked in</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to be submerged</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to be flooded</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: What is soaked and submerged in water (that shouldn't be)? It is your <reading>heater</reading> (<ja>ひた</ja>). It's all soaked and doesn't work anymore :(
